title: The Papers: UK race for boosters as NHS put on crisis footing
description: Many of Tuesday's papers show scenes of long queues as Britons rushed out to get Covid booster jabs.

title: Ros Atkins on... the Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen F1 title drama
description: Max Verstappen was crowned F1 world champion, after winning the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

title: Two detained after UK boat's fatal collision off Sweden
description: One person is dead and one missing after a Danish ship collides with a UK vessel in the Baltic Sea.

title: The strangers sharing stories on Edinburgh's listening bench
description: BBC Scotland's Angie Brown takes a seat on an Edinburgh bench where people are urged to chat to tackle loneliness.

title: Larry Nassar abuse survivors to receive $380m settlement
description: Hundreds of women abused by the ex-US gymnastics team doctor reach a settlement with USA Gymnastics.

title: How much does the diplomatic boycott of Beijing 2022 matter?
description: The Winter Olympics have been hit by a flurry of protests from governments in the West.

title: Formula 1: Where next for sport after Verstappen and Hamilton title drama?
description: Formula 1's controversial title decider highlights a deeper discontent over the rules and consistency of penalties handed out.

title: Harry Dunn crash: Anne Sacoolas case to go before UK court
description: Magistrates in London will hear the case concerning the death of motorcyclist Harry Dunn.

title: Post Office scandal: Government to foot bill for postmasters' compensation
description: The Department for Business said that the impact on postmasters' lives "cannot be overstated".

title: Paris 2024 opening ceremony to break with tradition and take place on River Seine
description: The 2024 Paris Olympics will break with tradition and hold the opening ceremony along the River Seine, with crowds of more than 600,000 expected.

title: US tornadoes: Is climate change to blame?
description: Are tornadoes becoming more frequent, dangerous or unpredictable - and is the changing climate to blame?

title: NatWest fined £265m after bin bags of cash laundered
description: The state-backed bank had pleaded guilty to failing to prevent money-laundering of nearly £400m.

title: Verstappen reveals Hamilton and Mercedes boss Wolff both congratulated him on title
description: Max Verstappen says he was congratulated by both Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff after winning the Formula 1 title.

title: Covid passports: Where will I need a pass and how do I get one?
description: England has announced a Covid passport scheme for entry to some venues.

title: Holders Chelsea face Lille in Champions League while Liverpool play Inter after last-16 draw chaos
description: Holders Chelsea will play Ligue 1 side Lille in the Champions League last 16 after the draw for the knockout stages took place for a second time.

title: Raducanu withdraws from Abu Dhabi exhibition event after testing positive for Covid-19
description: Emma Raducanu hopes to "get back soon" after testing positive for Covid-19 and withdrawing from the Mubadala World Tennis Championships.

title: Cars written off by Watford road bollards caught on camera
description: A number of vehicles including a police van have been seen colliding with the width restriction.

title: Tony's sorry for missing advent chocolate stunt
description: Tony's Chocolonely apologises for leaving an advent calendar window empty to highlight inequality.

title: Is a million boosters a day achievable? And other questions
description: The government has announced an ambitious plan to offer boosters to all adults in England.

title: Cabaret: Critics make song and dance over Eddie Redmayne musical
description: The new West End production, starring Eddie Redmayne and Jessie Buckley, opened to rave reviews.

title: First UK death recorded with Omicron variant
description: One person in the UK has died with Omicron variant of coronavirus, Prime Minister Boris Johnson confirms.

title: Justin Herbert, Tom Brady & Jakeem Grant in NFL plays of the week
description: Justin Herbert's incredible throw to Jalen Guyton for the LA Chargers is amongst a stellar selection of the best plays week from week 13 in the NFL.

title: Sergio Aguero: Barcelona's former Man City striker set to announce retirement on Wednesday
description: Sergio Aguero is set to announce his retirement on Wednesday, less than six months after joining Barcelona, reports Guillem Balague.

title: Hamilton 'a fantastic example on how to handle defeat' and will be back - Coulthard
description: Seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton is a "fantastic example" on "how to handle defeat" and is "committed" to coming back stronger next season, says ex-Formula 1 driver David Coulthard.

title: Covid: How does the alert level system work?
description: The rapid increase in Omicron cases in the UK has led to the alert level being raised.

title: Buy now pay later: How does it work?
description: It is estimated about 15 million adults of all ages in the UK are actively using this form of credit.

title: Trains: Crosskeys to Newport service is first since 1962
description: A village that shares its name with a pub toasts a rail link restored after 60 years.

title: Sports Personality 2021: Tom Daley, Tyson Fury, Adam Peaty, Emma Raducanu, Raheem Sterling and Sarah Storey up for award
description: A shortlist of six contenders is announced for the 2021 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.

title: Omicron: Should I be working from home now?
description: People across the UK are now being advised to work at home where possible.

title: Covid: Booster push to tackle Omicron and new working from home guidance
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Monday morning.

title: Petra Srncova: Body found is missing hospital worker
description: The Czech foreign minister confirms Petra Srncova's body has been found in a park in south London.

title: Nuclear fusion reactor experiment to produce clean energy
description: An experiment is taking place on an industrial estate just outside Didcot in the south of England.

title: Andy Zaltzman column: Why Joe Root is 1,000 times better than the next England batter
description: Comedian and Test Match Special statistician Andy Zaltzman looks at some of the weird and wonderful stats emerging from the Ashes.

title: Dog mutilation: Breeders cropping ears to follow social media trend
description: Puppies are having their ears cut by breeders for a "striking" look, a BBC investigation finds.

title: Kentucky tornadoes: Rebuilding lives from 'hell on Earth'
description: Residents in the US state are sifting through the rubble that was once a town.

title: The papers: A million jabs a day, as PM declares 'emergency'
description: Boris Johnson's announcement on expanding the booster jab rollout makes the front of most of Monday's papers.

title: Kentucky tornadoes: Death toll likely to pass 100, governor says
description: Rescue workers have continued to scour the rubble but hopes of finding survivors are waning.

title: And Just Like That Peloton resurrects show character
description: The exercise equipment maker released an online parody after a scene that sent its shares tumbling.

title: Covid: Work-from-home guidance reintroduced in England
description: People should now work from home if they can to help curb the spread of Omicron, the government says.

title: France resists US challenge to its values
description: The government is fighting back at what it sees as imported cultural ideas from the UK and US.

title: The ultra-violent cult that became a global mafia
description: A BBC investigation into Black Axe has unearthed new evidence of political infiltration, and a scamming and killing operation spanning the globe.

title: Howard University: Why these students slept out in tents on campus for weeks
description: After reports of mould and rodents in dorms, protesters at Howard University took over a campus building.

title: How hologram tech may soon replace video calls
description: The coronavirus pandemic and travel bans have accelerated interest in holographic communication.
